ProductsForAnimals.title: Products for Animals
ProductsForAnimals.description: Solutions designed to support animal health, productivity, and wellbeing across poultry, ruminants, and swine.

poultry.title: Poultry
poultry.coccidiosisDesc: Coccidiosis is one of the most serious poultry diseases worldwide. For many years, the problem of coccidiosis has been solved by the use of chemoprophylaxis.
poultry.coccidiosisSolution: Due to the increasing resistance of these parasites to existing solutions, it is reasonable to use plant-extract-based products with proven anti-coccidial effect as a preventative measure. KOKCIDIN® is a composition of carefully selected natural plant extracts demonstrating prophylactic anti-coccidial activity.
poultry.coccidiosisMechanism: The composition of KOKCIDIN® was developed and analysed by a team of experts in poultry nutrition. Its formulation demonstrates bacteriostatic and immunostimulatory activity. It may also be implemented as a solution to the problem of increased protozoal resistance to standard pharmaceuticals and consumer expectations regarding the quality of poultry meat and eggs. The positive effect of KOKCIDIN® is not only due to its direct effects on the parasites, but also results from the complex, broad activity of the compounds it contains. Among others effects, the stabilisation of bacterial flora (bacteriostatic activity), the stimulation of intestinal villi regeneration, the alleviation of intestinal inflammation, and the activation of immune processes have been confirmed.

ruminants.title: Ruminants
ruminants.description: Support for cattle and dairy performance.
ruminants.ketosisDesc: Ketosis is a common metabolic disease mainly occurring in cows with a high-yield milk production potential as a result of a negative energy balance and abnormal metabolism associated with energy shortages.
ruminants.ketosisStats: On farms with an average milk yield of 6000 kg per 305 days of lactation, ketosis occurs in 20% of cows. The highest risk of ketosis occurs between days 10 and 50 of lactation.
ruminants.ketosisSolution: The ideal solution is the administration of glucoplastic substances which increase blood glucose content and reduce the concentration of ketone bodies, supplementation with vitamins (niacin and choline) which regulate fat metabolism pathways and prevent fatty liver syndrome, as well as supplementation with vitamin E, zinc, and selenium, which stimulate the cow’s resistance to infections.

swine.title: Swine
swine.description: Solutions for swine growth and resilience.
swine.quickStartDesc: One of the most important phases in pig breeding is weaning time. During this period, piglets begin a stage of intensive growth and it is necessary to stimulate the development of the digestive system.
swine.quickStartSolution: Research on sodium butyrate show its capability to accelerate the development of the intestinal villi and inhibit the growth of bacteria from the Enterobacteriaceae family. Moreover, young animals are very sensitive to deficiencies of fat-soluble vitamins. Therefore, it is necessary to provide them with products which are rich in amino acids, fatty acid salts and ADEK vitamins. This accelerates the development of the animals and decreases future fattening time.

aboutKint.title: About KINT
aboutKint.description: Learn more about our research-driven approach and commitment to delivering reliable animal production solutions worldwide.

ProductsForAnimals.comingSoon: products and detailed recommendations will be available here soon.

ResearchDevelopment.title: Research & Development Centre
ResearchDevelopment.subtitle: Innovation driving agricultural excellence
ResearchDevelopment.intro: The existence of the Research and Development Centre at KINT Kafri International aligns with our corporate strategy, where great emphasis is put on research and development of innovative products designed for use in agriculture. Our research team includes world-class specialists in the areas of technology, chemistry, biology and microbiology.
ResearchDevelopment.labsIntro: The KINT Kafri International laboratories are equipped with modern instruments to perform a wide range of tasks including formulations, chemical analyses and biological research. They include four main laboratories: the formulation laboratory, analytical laboratory, biotechnology laboratory and biological research laboratory.

formulation.title: Formulation Research Laboratory
formulation.desc: This laboratory is equipped with high quality instruments for conducting tasks associated with the design and the development of new products.

analytical.title: Analytical Laboratory
analytical.desc: This laboratory is an important part of the KINT Kafri International product, quality control process. It performs the chemical composition analysis of the raw materials we use; of our manufactured products and of any newly developed formulations. This laboratory help facilitate the optimization of our research and development goals and a consistent high-quality product.

biotech.title: Biotechnology Laboratory
biotech.desc: This laboratory provides the environment and equipment where our microbiologists work on the development of new generations of biopreparations using isolations of selected strains of microorganisms.

biological.title: Biological Research Laboratory
biological.desc: This laboratory is equipped with a state of the art phytotron for conducting studies on plants in programmed and strictly controlled climatic conditions and an experimental tunnel for climate modeling which includes features such as automated heating, ventilation, shading, watering, and plant feeding systems.

ResearchDevelopment.mission: To provide a team of experienced committed, and passionate professionals, with modern equipment and instruments to develop and manufacture innovative preparations used in modern agriculture around the world. This constitutes the foundation of the KINT Kafri International mission.

TreatmentEfficacy.title: Treatment Efficacy
TreatmentEfficacy.subtitle: Maximizing the potential of every application through precision science and optimal conditions.
TreatmentEfficacy.whyMattersDesc1: In modern agriculture, the efficiency of applied treatments is crucial not just for economic returns, but for environmental sustainability. At KINT, we focus on understanding the variables that influence how plants absorb and utilize nutrients and biostimulants.
TreatmentEfficacy.whyMattersDesc2: Our research ensures that every drop of product provides maximum benefit, reducing waste and improving crop health.

optimum.title: Optimum Conditions for Foliar Treatments
optimum.desc: Discover the critical environmental factors—temperature, humidity, light, and wind—that determine the success of foliar applications.

OptimumConditions.title: Optimum Conditions for Foliar Treatments
OptimumConditions.subtitle: Key environmental factors for maximizing the effectiveness of foliar fertilizers and biostimulants.

download.title: Download Full Guide
download.desc: PDF with complete optimum conditions reference

humidity.title: Air Humidity
humidity.desc1: When treating in lower humidity conditions, use plant safe preparations (e.g. chelates or amino chelates instead of simple salts).
humidity.desc2: High relative humidity promotes longer persistence of the liquid on the plant surface, which allows more efficient penetration of the preparation into the plant and improves the effectiveness of the applied preparations.

temperature.title: Air Temperature
temperature.desc1: Foliar fertilizers are most often used together with pesticides. Therefore, it is important that the label indicates the air temperature at which the pesticide is effective. This information refers not only to the temperature range at which the active ingredient is effective, but also to the temperature at which the treatment can be safely applied to plants.
temperature.desc2: Temperatures below the optimum will slow the uptake of ingredients from the solution and reduce the effectiveness of the applied product.
temperature.desc3: At temperatures above 25°C, there is an increased risk of plant tissue damage due to rapid evaporation of water from the solution applied to the leaves. In addition, when treatments (especially fine droplets) are applied at high temperatures and low humidity, a significant amount of the applied liquid will not reach the plants due to evaporation.

sunlight.title: Moderate Sunlight
sunlight.desc: Strong sunlight can cause rapid evaporation of the spray solution and may lead to leaf burn (phytotoxicity), especially when droplets act as lenses. It is recommended to apply treatments early in the morning or late in the afternoon/evening to avoid peak sunlight intensity.

wind.title: Light Wind
wind.desc: Wind speed affects the uniformity of coverage. High winds can cause drift, reducing efficacy and potentially affecting non-target areas. Optimum wind speed is generally low (< 3 m/s). Avoid spraying in gusty or high wind conditions.

waterTemperature.title: Water Temperature
waterTemperature.desc: This parameter is particularly important for proper solution preparation (e.g. dissolving solid products, homogenizing the solution).

bestTime.title: Best Time to Spray
bestTime.desc: In hot weather, the best time to spray crops with agrochemicals is in the late afternoon or in the evening and night hours – until a heavy dew forms. In addition, pollinating insects have completed their flight in the evening, the wind tends to die down, and there is no spray drift.

whoWeAre.title: Get to Know Us
whoWeAre.subtitle: Who is KINT
whoWeAre.tagline: Specialists in providing all agricultural and veterinary materials.
whoWeAre.description:
KINT International is a global leader in the agricultural sector, providing innovative solutions for plant and animal nutrition since 1988. We are committed to excellence and sustainability in everything we do.

Our expertise spans across multiple continents, bringing the latest biotechnology to farmers and agricultural enterprises worldwide. We believe in the power of science to transform agriculture and ensure food security for the future.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.subtitle: Your Harvest is Bigger, Your Profit is Sure
mission.tagline: Specialists in providing all agricultural and veterinary materials.
mission.description:
Our mission is to enhance solutions to increase agricultural production efficiency while caring for the environment and food safety. Therefore, our products can significantly increase crop yields, improve their quality, and increase the productivity and health of animals.

We strive to be at the forefront of agricultural innovation, delivering value to our partners and customers through research-driven products and expert technical support.

ambition.title: Our Ambition
ambition.subtitle: Investing in Medicine to Protect Our Animal and Plant Wealth
ambition.tagline: Specialists in providing all agricultural and veterinary materials.
ambition.description:
Our ambition is to become the leading provider of the most modern solutions for farmers and help them increase animal and plant agricultural productivity.

In addition, we will provide specialized advisory services to farmers, where we will provide them with professional information and guidance that helps them make the right decisions and improve the performance of their farms. We will work to build strategic partnerships with farmers and agricultural institutions to achieve cooperation and exchange of knowledge and experience.

We are committed to innovation and continuous development, and seek to provide the most updated and innovative solutions for farmers.
